unnormalised: New Delhi – The Indian telecom sector is witnessing a significant push towards Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) connectivity, driven by increasing demand for high-speed internet access. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, expanding their FTTH networks across urban and rural landscapes.
normalised: New Delhi – The Indian telecom sector is witnessing a significant push towards Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) connectivity, driven by increasing demand for high-speed internet access. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, expanding their F T T H networks across urban and rural landscapes.

unnormalised: This expansion aims to bridge the digital divide and cater to the growing needs of online education, e-commerce, and digital entertainment. Recent reports indicate that over 2 million new FTTH connections were added in Q3 2024 alone.
normalised: This expansion aims to bridge the digital divide and cater to the growing needs of online education, e-commerce, and digital entertainment. Recent reports indicate that over two million new F T T H connections were added in Q three two thousand and twenty four alone.

unnormalised: "Our commitment is to connect every home in Bharat with reliable and affordable fiber optic internet," stated a senior executive from Airtel during a press briefing on 26/01/2024. Jio is reportedly investing Rs. 10,000 Crore to lay approximately 50,000 km of fiber optic cable by 15/08/2025. BSNL is also revamping its infrastructure to compete, aiming for significant improvements by 31/12/2024 at 17:00 hrs. The aggressive rollout is expected to benefit consumers across India, providing them with faster and more reliable internet services. This development will further bolster India's digital transformation journey.
normalised: "Our commitment is to connect every home in Bharat with reliable and affordable fiber optic internet," stated a senior executive from Airtel during a press briefing on twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty four. Jio is reportedly investing rupee ten thousand crore to lay approximately fifty thousand kilometer of fiber optic cable by fifteenth August two thousand and twenty five. B S N L is also revamping its infrastructure to compete, aiming for significant improvements by thirty first December two thousand and twenty four at five zero zero hours. The aggressive rollout is expected to benefit consumers across India, providing them with faster and more reliable internet services. This development will further bolster India's digital transformation journey.
